content: I can understand how this game has had a revenue of over $5bn. It's addictive, fun, & frustrating. Was a whale for a week, but have decided to uninstall as of today, as paying $$$ gives you no competitive edge - I'd say in fact it does the opposite. I'm not going to feed the beast any more. Was fun, though, while it lasted. content: This is a very creative, thoughtfully designed, rewarding game. You don't have to spend money. There are no "Pay-walls". You can run out of money and dice, but you get daily login bonuses, and patience will build you a fortune. I didn't log in for a couple of weeks and came back to millions of dollars and hundreds of dice. This is one of the best games of this type I have ever played! It borrows from a few other game structures and gives it that Classic Monopoly flair.

I've been seeing posts online from up to 10 months ago of people having the same issue, and there's still no resolution.

content: Ever notice you miss the prize by just a little? that is on purpose! This game uses "predatory monetization," where algorithms analyze your playstyle, session length, and spending history to adjust your "luck" factor. From there, they collect the most money before you grow bored and stop playing (Billions, actually). Everyone should report to Google (in the Play Store), and the FTC: ftc.gov/complaint. Scopely is clearly engaged in "deceptive practices", they just haven't been investigated.

author: Papa Bear

content: Love the old Monopoly board game? You'll love this. The creators did a great job translating the original game into a mobile game, showing that its themes have only grown more relevant with time. How they do pvp is clever (which is good, because it isn't optional): you steal money from other players, but only from ones way richer than you who most likely won't notice what's gone. I sure don't. Great commentary there. Ad assault is the main downside. As well as slower progress if unpaid.
